page.title: 06TRANSPORT NEAR SEISDON
page.content: Transport, or rather, the lack of it, presents a major problem in this district. A regular bus route runs several times a day along the A454 between Wolverhampton and Bridgnorth and another, very restricted service meanders from Claverley to Wolverhampton, through the villages, only touching this area at Seisdon. Limited as these services are they are at present under threat because of current legislation de-regularising bus services and local people fear even greater isolation. People who do not live within walking distance of one of these bus routes are dependant on private cars for all their transport needs, including travelling to work, shopping,visiting the Doctor's surgery and social life.
